definition: to be picky/to be choosy
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
surname San
three/3
to choose/to pick/to sort out/to pick up
four/4

sentences.english: Susan picked and chose her dresses, but did not buy any.
sentences.chinese: Susan在裙子堆里挑三拣四，却一件也没买。

sentences.english: He is never choosy about his job.
sentences.chinese: 他对工作从不挑三拣四。

sentences.english: No, it’s always easier to nitpick than actually to cook the meal.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，挑三拣四比实际下厨做饭总是要容易得多。

sentences.english: Don't form a habit of being choosy.
sentences.chinese: 不要养成挑三拣四的习惯。

definition: to pick on sth incessantly (idiom)/to criticize right and left
pinyin: heng2 tiao1 bi2 zi5 shu4 tiao1 yan3

definition: picky/fussy
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to look for bones in an egg/to find fault/to nitpick (idiom)
pinyin: ji1 dan4 li5 tiao1 gu3 tou5

definition: to regard with disdain/to shun
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
to carp/nitpicking/petty criticism
pretentious/striking a pose
to nitpick/petty criticism/to nag

lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/to remark upon a person's appearance/nitpicking/overcritical/judgmental
(coll.) hard to please/high-maintenance
when hungry, you can't pick what you eat (idiom); beggars can't be choosers/When matters are urgent, don't spend time choosing alternatives.
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
to use all sorts of excuses
lit. to climb all over sb/fig. to take advantage of sb's weakness
